SceneText.FriendlyName: Capital City Balka - Apartment Building 3nd Floor

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka

Entry.JapaneseText: 首都バルカ・集合住宅三階
Entry.EnglishText: Capital City Balka - Apartment Building 3rd Floor

Entry.JapaneseText: 集合住宅三階
Entry.EnglishText: Apartment Building 3rd Floor

Entry.JapaneseText: 儀式が近いって 浮かれる人が多いわね。
Entry.EnglishText: There's a lot of people excited for the inauguration ceremony.

Entry.JapaneseText: 下に住んでるおばあさんも 毎日部屋ん中で調子っぱずれの 鼻歌歌ってるわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: The old lady who lives downstairs has been humming out-of-tune every day.

Entry.JapaneseText: 下のおばあさん、お披露目の 儀式に行くみたいね……
Entry.EnglishText: I think the old lady downstairs plans on attending the inauguration ceremony...

Entry.JapaneseText: 一緒に行ったら、少しは 仲良くなれるかしら？
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if we can go together and get to know each other?

Entry.JapaneseText: 下に住むおばあさんが うるさいって小言ばかり……
Entry.EnglishText: That old hag downstairs is always complaining about how noisy I am...
Entry.Notes: Changed it to old hag to indicate her shift to being annoyed with the old lady. Feel free to change it to old lady if you think it's better.

Entry.JapaneseText: うるさいのはお互い様って感じよ。 ついこの間までは、それでも 許してくれてたのにさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I should say the same to her! To think, she used to tolerate me...
Entry.Notes: Not sure if I should use tolerate, allow, or forgive.

Entry.JapaneseText: ホントにヒューマって むかつくわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma sure are annoying...

Entry.JapaneseText: 儀式が延期になったのは、 ヒューマの悪党どもが 邪魔をしたかららしいわよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Apparently the inauguration ceremony was postponed because some Huma thugs interfered...

Entry.JapaneseText: 許せないわ……ヒューマ……
Entry.EnglishText: What those Huma did is unforgiveable...

Entry.JapaneseText: ホントにヒューマって むかつくわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma sure are annoying...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何かにつけて、ガジュマに いちゃもんつけて来て……！
Entry.EnglishText: They keep trying to find faults in anything we Gajuma do!

Entry.JapaneseText: あたしたちガジュマが いつまでもガマンしてると 思ったら大間違いよ！
Entry.EnglishText: If they think we Gajuma are just gonna sit back and take it, then they're way wrong!

Entry.JapaneseText: 下に住むおばあさんが うるさいって小言ばかり……
Entry.EnglishText: That old hag downstairs is always complaining about how noisy I am...

Entry.JapaneseText: うるさいのはお互い様って感じよ。 ついこの間までは、それでも 許してくれてたのにさ……
Entry.EnglishText: I should say the same to her! To think, she used to tolerate me...
Entry.Notes: Not sure if I should use tolerate, allow, or forgive. this line is repeating so any change needs to be ported over

Entry.JapaneseText: ホントにヒューマって むかつくわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma sure are annoying...

Entry.JapaneseText: 何かにつけて、ガジュマに いちゃもんつけて来て……！
Entry.EnglishText: They keep trying to find faults in anything we Gajuma do!

Entry.JapaneseText: あたしたちガジュマが いつまでもガマンしてると 思ったら大間違いよ！
Entry.EnglishText: If they think we Gajuma are just gonna sit back and take it, then they're way wrong!

Entry.JapaneseText: 下のおばあさんがネチネチと うるさくって、やってられないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: That old hag downstairs is way too noisy. I can't stand her!

Entry.JapaneseText: この前、街でうるさいヒューマの 子供がいたから、思いっきり ひっぱたいてやったわ……！
Entry.EnglishText: The other day, there was this really noisy Huma kid on the streets, so I slapped him as hard as I could...!

Entry.JapaneseText: ホントにスッキリした…… ヒューマをいじめるのって 最高のストレス解消かも……
Entry.EnglishText: It was really refreshing... Beating up Huma is probably the best stress reliever...

Entry.JapaneseText: いいところに来たわね。 あたしヒューマを思いっきり 殴りたい気分なの……
Entry.EnglishText: You've come at a good time. I just happened to be in the mood to beat up Huma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ねえ、殴らせてくれない!?
Entry.EnglishText: You're gonna let me hit you, right?

Entry.JapaneseText: 薬を売ってる場所を知りたい？ あんた、ガジュマをバカに してるわけ？
Entry.EnglishText: You want to know where they sell medicine? What, do you think we Gajuma are stupid?

Entry.JapaneseText: 知ってるに決まってるでしょ！ バカバカしくて答える気にも なれないわ！
Entry.EnglishText: Of course I know where they sell it! I'm not going to answer such a stupid question, though!

Entry.JapaneseText: 下のおばあさんが、 引越しを考えてるみたい。 ちょっと残念……
Entry.EnglishText: Looks like that old hag downstairs is thinking of moving out. What a shame...

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマを踏みつけてるみたいで とても気分が良かったのに……！
Entry.EnglishText: It always felt so good to have her down there... It was almost as though I was stepping on a Huma!

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様が演説で言ってたよ！ これからはヒューマを 殴っていいってね。
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Zilva said in her speech that it's high time we Gajuma start fighting back against you Huma.
Entry.Notes: May need to revise "strike down" to something else; in Zilva's speech I think she uses the word persecute, but literally it's punch/strike. Reason I used strike was because this woman actually hits a Huma earlier.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマがみんな悪いのよ…… ガジュマをバカにして、 差別して来たヒューマが……！
Entry.EnglishText: There's not a single good Huma... All of you ridicule and discriminate against us Gajuma...!

Entry.JapaneseText: 地鳴りは気になるけど、 おかげで下のおばあさんを 気にせずに暮らせていいわ！
Entry.EnglishText: I'm kinda worried about these tremors, but at least the noise is drowning out that hag downstairs!

Entry.JapaneseText: ラジルダが崩壊したそうだけど、 生き残った人たちは、どこへ 行くのかしら……
Entry.EnglishText: With Razilda destroyed, I wonder where the survivors will go...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが街に来るならいいけど、 ヒューマは来ないで欲しいわ……
Entry.EnglishText: I'm fine if Gajuma were to come here, but I'd rather the Huma go elsewhere...

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様が演説で言ってたよ！ これからはヒューマを 殴っていいってね。
Entry.EnglishText: Lady Zilva said in her speech that it's high time we Gajuma start fighting back against you Huma.

Entry.JapaneseText: ヒューマがみんな悪いのよ…… ガジュマをバカにして、 差別して来たヒューマが……！
Entry.EnglishText: There's not a single good Huma... All of you ridicule and discriminate against us Gajuma...!

Entry.JapaneseText: バイラスのせいで、 街はメチャクチャよ……！
Entry.EnglishText: This city is in disarray do to all those Biruses!

Entry.JapaneseText: あたしも早く逃げなきゃ……
Entry.EnglishText: I need to get out of here too...

Entry.JapaneseText: 邪魔だよ、どいたどいた！
Entry.EnglishText: You're a nuisance! Get out!

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしてこの世界には、 ガジュマとヒューマが いるんだろうねえ……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder why both Gajuma and Huma exist in this world...

Entry.JapaneseText: みんなガジュマなら、 争いもないだろうに……
Entry.EnglishText: If everyone were Gajuma, then there would be no conflict...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『かわいいワンちゃん情報』 飼い主が愛情を注いだ分だけ、 ワンちゃんは応えてくれます。 やさしい性格の子になります。 でも、悪い事をした時には、 きちんと叱りましょう。 棒で叩いてはいけません。 言葉で叱りましょう。 ワンちゃんはきっと理解します。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- How to Raise a Lovable Dog - The more you love your dog, the more he will respond to your affections. He will become a very affectionate dog. However, when he does something wrong, be sure to scold him properly. Do not hit him, rather, scold him with words. Your dog is sure to understand what you tell him.
Entry.Notes: 情報 is literally "Information", but the text is more like a guide on raising a puppy.
